definition: to give no cause for anxiety/nothing to worry about
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: If you don't, then his catastrophic conclusions are irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不信，那他得出的灾难性结论就根本不足为虑。

sentences.english: Electronic commerce may not amount to much at the moment, but it is growing very fast.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务目前看来虽不足为虑，但其增长速度很快。

sentences.english: Years ago, the country's pig population wasn't much of a concern.
sentences.chinese: 多年前，越南的猪群数量还不足为虑。

definition: lit. calamity within one's bosom (idiom); major trouble hidden within
remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
ruined army, defeated general (idiom); scattered remnants
lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
a centipede dies but never falls down/old institutions die hard
pinyin: bai3 zu2 zhi1 chong2 si3 er2 bu4 jiang1

definition: lit. strong soldiers and sturdy horses (idiom)/fig. a well-trained and powerful army
